website_summaries.verdict: A sound choice if you prefer a large, single-bin tumbler and want to save money.
pros: A spacious, 80-gallon bin with a large opening
cons: Instructions aren't clear, making assembly frustrating
Capacity is spacious, but it has only one chamber in the large bin

customer_reviews.title: They work well turning kitchen garbage into compost rather quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for composting for my tomatoes. They work well turning kitchen garbage into compost rather quickly. They are easy to assemble (about 1/2 hour to 45 min. Max) one thing I did was reinforce the three lids to the sides by adding additional screws (about 5 more each ) it can get heavy and if you don't do that it will fall apart ( have seen that on some pictures on reviews)
customer_reviews.author: juan c. blacutt

customer_reviews.title: FURIOUS
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this, I should not be required to use a power drill to put holes through plastic which should have been either part of the the mold OR predrilled by the manufacturer. Fine, I'm still doing it because I'm not a princess and I want to use this thing. At least they included a drill bit, right? WRONG. The bit snapped off halfway through drilling the holes in the second panel. If I didn't stupidly recycle the box already this morning, this thing would have gone back the second I deciphered the instructions. Do not buy this if you don't have a drill, drill bits, 2-3 hours to kill and the patience of a saint.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: it worked great for the first 3 months i had it
customer_reviews.text: i was supper excited about this product when i ordered it! it worked great for the first 3 months i had it. after that like anything plastic and cheap it fell apart... i have a lifetime shed that works great so i wasn’t exciting such poor results from a company i trusted in. for what i spent on the composter i would have been better off to just go buy the dirt i needed... unfortunately i was trying to cut down waste in landfills and am going to end up sending this composter to the landfill this week.... very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Nate Ustianowski

customer_reviews.title: One hinge tighter than the other
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions and found the hinges did not pull the lid shut nice and snug. Now over a year later, my compost has dropped completely out while tumbling because one of the hinges is a looser clamp than the others. I will likely wrap a tie-down strap around the entire composter for added support. Functionally I'm suspecting the tie-down strap will work but for the money I paid for this thing, I'm disappointed that I'm having to improvise to make this thing work. Aside from the hinges being weak, overall I think the plastic is durable and will hold up for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: They were good about sending them out
customer_reviews.text: Some of the screws didn't work in tightened down. They were good about sending them out. But the thing took so long to put together. And then when you started trying to compost, the tube fell out that supposed to aerate the compost. And it probably break things down also. But I don't know because the tube is not designed well and it just pops out. Once it pops out there's no way to get it in without taking the whole thing apart. Not a great design. I was really looking forward to it because it's a bigger one at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compostinator!
customer_reviews.text: Although a little challenging to assemble this has worked great for us for 4 years. We are buying another one because we need the compost. Once started the scraps breakdown remarkably well. It is sturdy as well. We have filled this many times and it gets heavy, I do not worry about tipping over as the stand is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Compost tumbler
customer_reviews.text: The finished product is very good and sturdy [for the price]. However it is a monster to assemble. the base and rotating side are easy enough, but not a single piece part is assembled even where it would not increase shipping size. Also none of the screw holes are pre-drilled. The worst part is the assembly of the three panels of the barrel cylinder. Pre-marked un-drilled screw holes do not line up very well and the screw and plastic nuts are very cheap. You will need two people to attach these screws [one outside one inside]. Allow many times the recommended time if this is your first one to assemble and watch the U-tube 'how to assemble' before starting.
customer_reviews.author: pmorlimont

customer_reviews.title: Good thought/Bad design
customer_reviews.text: First don't believe the quantity you will be able to hold in this. Due to it being plastic and the poorly designed concept, you can only get about half (if that) of the stated capacity. The legs on this item are not sturdy enough for the capacity. The hinges and their attachment to the plastic are not designed for the capacity The barrel is extremely hard to turn and rotate once you are a 1/3 or more of capacity. If you are serious about composting just build ground bins. If you are urban/metro limited composter this might work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Luther Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble, but nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like this compost tumbler, but I've got a couple complaints that hold me back from highly recommending it. 1) Assembly was a huge pain. It took several hours, and required another pair of hands at a couple points. 2) A couple things make filling it irritating. First, there's no convenient handle for opening the up, without having it flop open and have debris and moisture fly out. Second, it's not totally watertight, and so compost juice leaks out. That said, it definitely does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit for us
customer_reviews.text: It does not breath enough so the compost was constantly too wet and full of maggots and bugs. It was hard for my wife to turn because it was so heavy with wet stuff in it. Water would not drain out of it, so I drilled some drain holes in it which helped, but then she had trouble getting the compost out of it without spilling it all over the place. Plus the capacity was too small. So we sold it and built three large bins out of pallets. We love the pallets!
customer_reviews.author: Big HD Truck

customer_reviews.title: The hindges did not hold.
customer_reviews.text: When thee composter was only partially filled less than 25% turning it all the contents dumped onto my feet! Very Disapointing!! after an adjustment they worked again for a short while and again most of the contents at my feet attracting bugs etc. The size Design all seems great but the hinge design must be changed. It was not the least expensive option we have a large garden and luckily it is not near the house otherwise the bugs it attracts would be horrific.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Box Distroyed - Pieces Missing
customer_reviews.text: Received this product this week. The box was absolutely distroyed. Tried putting it together this weekend, only to find out that most of the hardware is missing. So disappointing. I now have a compost barrel in pieces, and a box in shreds.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria C

customer_reviews.title: Horrible shipping
customer_reviews.text: The box looks like it was dropped off the back of a truck and dragged, put back on the truck, taped up and left on my porch. Parts are rattling loose inside and falling out of the holes. Moving box around sounds like a kids rattle! Returning for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Opa

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is a PAIN but finished product is nice.
customer_reviews.text: It’s definitely a two person job to assemble and you won’t do it quickly. You will also need several different sizes sockets, screw driver, drill and LOTS of patience. The instructions were ok but confusing in places. The hardware was well packaged and labeled. It is very sturdy and once we got it together I was pleased. However, getting to that point resulted in some questionable language and busted knuckles. I like the large lid that makes it easier to load and dump. With all of that said, I’m glad I got the one I did and it should last me as long as I need it to. I just wish it came pre-assembled.
customer_reviews.author: K. Staines

customer_reviews.title: Get 2.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but you really need two of them to work efficiently: One that you're adding to, and one that is cooking off. We've found that it's best to start with a base of wood chips and lawn clippings. This heats up very fast and helps it digest the kitchen waste. We've had ours for 2 years outside in the sun and they've held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Not as hard to assemble as they say and I'm 51 y.o. woman
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 51 y.o. woman and I assembled this in approximately 1.5 hours. Yes, the directions stink but I searched for a video on how to install first. The video was NOT put out by the manufacturer, but rather an individual guy who created a series of 3 videos on how to install. His lighting is not the best though. In this day and age, the manufacturer should highly consider a quick and professional assembly video to assist folks and I'm sure they would get 5 star ratings. Once together, it works great but is hard to turn when full.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Zawacki

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT STAY LATCHED. This would be a great product if the latches stayed locked when rotating. It’s way too big and cumbersome to return or we would. The latches are so weak when you spin it the whole thing opens up from the weight of the compost. We have had to wrap a bungee cord around to to keep it shut when rotating. SO disappointed- this was a very expensive purchase and part of its appeal is its rotating feature; which requires it to remain closed. Would look elsewhere for your compost bin unless you don’t plan on rotating your compost.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: One star for packaging and assembly.  5 stars for assembled unit  Average 3
customer_reviews.text: The reviews that say not easy to assemble are correct. It took 2 hrs my time plus an hour of a second person. I think this is unreasonable for this price product. In addition, I have purchased two of these. Both came with the packaging in shambles. The last one had parts hanging out of the box. This is not a one time occurance However once assembled it appears durable. Easy to fill and turn. My first load composted in just 3 weeks so it's off to composting a huge backlog of organic waste. After some time assembly problems will fade and I’ll be using this for years hopefully
customer_reviews.author: John Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Composter is great !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this 2 years and works great once I knew the formula of green to brown and saw that I could use horse bedding pellets for the brown or carbon. Now the compost is heating at from 128 degrees F to 144 degrees F. before I never had the right combination for the composting to work right. It definitely has a big opening for placing food scraps and grass clippings and for removing the finished compost. I definitely will get another if I decide to increase my compost output.
customer_reviews.author: Bud in Va

customer_reviews.title: Not rated for Arizona summer heat
customer_reviews.text: The latches are not very secure and the lid and walls become flimsy in the heat. It worked great for the first few months, but the plastic kept getting flimsier and the latches became looser as the weather got warmer. It started leaking compost out the side of the lid as turn it, then the latches came loose and dumped out all of my compost.
customer_reviews.author: Dorian

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this. It took two of us about 3 hours to put it together. A lot of bending which we didn't enjoy at 70 years of age. I have it filled with careful layering and moisture control plus compost starter. I have not seen much decomposition yet, probably due to the cool weather. It did get wetter when it rained and liquid dripped out the bottom, so I have a bucket under it now to catch the "tea". I tumble it every 4 days but have not seen much progress.
customer_reviews.author: R. Best

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this tumbler.
customer_reviews.text: There is no ventilation so without oxygen the compost ends up being more like sewer sludge. It is also hard to spin with all of that moisture adding to the weight. It was a little hard to assemble (had to drill out screw holes) and I am a maintenance engineer.
customer_reviews.author: starrman

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were missing certain information that would have made sense to have in there...such as to locate the aerator tube near the lid... Pretty easy to assemble. Seems to be a good product. We've been loading it for a month now with vegetable remnant and egg shells and it just smells like veggie paste when you open the lid. No notable smell when closed. May get more smell in Summer but who knows...it's not summer right now. Follow the instructions for use. If you put non-veggie stuff in there...like meat, eggs... it'll stink. The quality and durability seem actually to be Lifetime-quality.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Watch the Build Videos! Amazing & Totally Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: My wife & I are building our own mini-orchard and though, as many have said, this took a fair amount of time & tools to build, it is built to last and is no harder than any IKEA item to put together. We get some torrential weather given our location and this thing has survived empty and packed to the hinges through storms with hurricane-fierce winds. If you have any desire to build even a medium-sized garden, I'd give this composter a look!
customer_reviews.author: Rocoda

customer_reviews.title: My first composter
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together, there was one confusing part and we had to back out of it when we realized that we bolted everything together and my husband thought I'd have to get inside to finish (OR we could have just read the instructions and saved ourselves having to take parts apart and re-put together). So far it seems very sturdy, it does get quite heavy so I'd give it a low score on "manueverability" but who is moving a compost bin anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy, mid-sized
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy, mid-sized, composter. Its waist-level height makes it easy to fill. Sturdy latches make it critter-proof, and a pin locks the tumbler in place after rotating composting material. As one other reviewer comments, it is not easy to assemble(took my husband about 4 hours), but I give it 5 stars because It's made of materials to last a lifetime. Prior to this purchase, I had ordered a comparably priced composter which arrived with broken plastic parts and had to be repackaged and returned.
customer_reviews.author: KSS1945

customer_reviews.title: great composter
customer_reviews.text: we purchased this composter 6 years ago and it continues to function without complaint. recently we assembled a 2nd that was given to us. assembly requires an electric drill, several wrenches and screwdrivers, some sockets are helpful, and on occasion a second set of hands. these requirements suggest some facility with tools is helpful. the directions for assembly seem adequate, in multiple languages, but should be read. however, i was tempted by the instructive diagrams to just bound ahead and that seemed to work for the most part as well. it's a well engineered product. how effective a composter composts depends on the user - this big 'guy' does its part.
customer_reviews.author: dillwood

customer_reviews.title: Half the key parts are missing
customer_reviews.text: Really upset with this - when you ship a product have the courtesy to make sure its complete. The locking pin and all of the clamps and hinges are missing, and if I have to wait several weeks to get them I am going to get really mad. The product seems good, but apparently I am not the only one that finds many of the key parts are missing. And of course by the time you unpack it, its too complicated to return.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Huggett

customer_reviews.title: it was initially really great. However
customer_reviews.text: It's a huge pain to put together; plan on hours. After assembly, it was initially really great. However, as time has passed, it has developed issues. It no longer has "tightness." There are times where the latches aren't really holding well and it feels risky to tumble it. Though it holds a lot, as it gets heavier, it becomes very difficult to pull out the stopper to tumble it, and it is so hard to tumble, I can't do it myself. I have to have my husband do it, and I'm no weakling.
customer_reviews.author: Terry K.

customer_reviews.title: This tumbler is bigger than I realized for a first time composter!
customer_reviews.text: The box came to us very banged up but the material of this tumbler is strong so it was okay. This is very sturdy and easy to rotate by hand. My husband and I put it together while one of us read the directions. It was just a little confusing but we got it right eventually..had to remove a few screws and start again. It would've been difficult for me to put together alone. This also holds a lot. I put scraps in it two times a week and give it a turn 2-3 times a week. It will take us awhile to fill it. When spring arrives we will have compost for our gardens.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Harris

customer_reviews.title: I use this to mix potting soil.
customer_reviews.text: I am a small grower. I pot up about a 1000 plants a year. I use this to mix up my potting soil not as a composter. It is not big enough for me to compost in. It is very effective as a soil mixer and I actually bought this one for my daughter because she liked mine. You need two people to assemble it or at least 4 hands. It isn't hard to do it just requires extra hands but it is sturdy mine is at least 6 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Senyas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but frustrating to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars out of because: 1. Directions did not match parts. My set of directions referred to part sets by a 3 letter ID. The part sets all had different 3 letter sets. 2. Many holes must be drilled to assemble it. While they include a Drill bit mine broke on the first use. Once assembled it's fine. Sturdy and large enough to produce a good quantity of compost.
customer_reviews.author: Jp Huller

customer_reviews.title: Nice composter
customer_reviews.text: The unit is a little difficult to assemble. I really like the ease of turning the compost with this unit. I bought 2 for myself and 1 for my mom. The only complaint I have with the compost tumbler is that the lid has popped open twice on one of them. If you don't turn the compost very often, the compost can compact into one large solid mass. If this large mass falls onto the lid while turning, the lid will pop open and spill partially composted material on the ground. Then you have to shovel it back into the unit.
customer_reviews.author: James Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to tumble
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Can be assemble by anyone who is handy following the directions (watch that there is a large washer on the inner chamber and one on the outside of the spacer). However, the basically triangular design requires the you use extra strength to tumble. All the leverage is against you, the load is at the bottom on a valley.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S. Widner

customer_reviews.title: Good made
customer_reviews.text: Took us some time to put together, but totally worth it! We had it for about 9 months now. Love it so far! We had a bear come to it couple times, turn it over and tried to get inside, but failed. You can clearly see claw and bite marks on the side (bear did puncture a few extra ventilation holes ;-) ) but it didn't open, held together perfectly. All we did was turn it back up and continue using. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too many parts..
customer_reviews.text: very unwieldily to assemble..really takes 2 people or more even things don't line up that well requiring some brute force lid takes a huge amount of space to open price was right but my guess why this was on clearance is that so many people returned it i just happen to be stubborn
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh :\
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived (a day late albeit), and upon arrival, I noticed the box was mangled on various sides/corners. Onces opened, I noticed the inner boxes with the tools and screws were slightly torn open, and after inspection, noticed some parts were missing. I could of returned it, but I just went to Home Depot and purchased the washers and screws needed to finish the installation. Overall I like the product, but disliked the services from this vendor
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Negron

customer_reviews.title: Wet pleased with this composter
customer_reviews.text: Not for the faint of heat to assemble although it’s not as bad as some folks say to assemble. I have to laugh that some people said they are engineers and had trouble assembling - they really need to find another job if this was hard for them. You just need to look at YouTube videos and follow the directions. My wife and I had it done in less than an hour and a half. Seems like it will hold up and last. Not easy for my wife to turn though...
customer_reviews.author: NCAmazonCust

customer_reviews.title: Medium
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough but once in use and in the sun some problems arise. The plastic warps in the sun. I live in Maine so not super hot. The closing clamps come open sometimes while turning and compost spills out. Good for keeping vermin out of the compost though. Was thinking of getting a 2nd one but have changed my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Just got it and assembled in <1 hour
customer_reviews.text: We have not put it into use yet, but it if it holds up, this composted is pretty amazing for the price. Easy to assemble, easy to turn, and the best feature is that it has a large opening to add and take out the compost material. So many others just have a slot and we want to be able to shovel it out.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. White

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps the worst instructions I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Of course had to resort to google / Youtube. It may work out in the long run, but I am average to above average when it comes to home projects. I have worked as a labor and handyman. These are without a doubt the lest intuitive directions and engineering / design that I can recall. Once assembled it may work well., but question the effort at this point. I did get it assembled with lots of work...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: So, after struggling with stirring our compost by hand in a large bin for a few years, we finally tired of the overwhelming smell and the labor that went behind it. Because of such we got lazy about stirring it, and it took forever to break down. We finally made the switch to these tumblers, and they work fantastic! Our first one, that we purchased around 3 months ago already has usable compost in it. They are easy to put together with great instructions as well. Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Huge composter. Tedious assembly. But I think it will be worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic composter. Once you get it together. But that process is a work out even with two people. It would be very difficult with only one. The directions are good once you figure them out. We just place the composter out by our garden and are excited to see it do it’s magic
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: It takes a craftsman to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This product required a lot of drilling in metal and in plastic. These holes could have been pre-drilled as is the case in similar products. It took 1 1/2 hours to assemble for 3 people one of whom was a skilled craftsperson. If you are not handy, you could not put this together. Once assembled, it is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Henry J. George

customer_reviews.title: Great composter.
customer_reviews.text: We assembled this in just under 2 hrs. It is best with two people as the plastic nuts on the inside are hard to reach while screwing from the outside. Also would have helped to clearly state that the lid is removable when the product is complete. Once completed we love the size overall, the size of the opening, and the ease of turning.
customer_reviews.author: ols

customer_reviews.title: I so wish I didn't spend my money on such a poor product!
customer_reviews.text: There are no written instruction with it! Just poorly instructive diagrams that don't even refer to the correct part #s. One of the large pieces was crushed in the center on arrival. VERY difficult to assemble. MUST have two people to put together (should have been disclosed in sales review). All plastic pieces do not fit together snugly. The metal clamps and hinges are all but impossible to attach. I so wish I didn't spend my money on such a poor product!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Ann Harley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use.  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this after reading numerous reviews about how difficult it was to assemble. I am likely handier than the average homeowner as I am a carpenter by trade. Put this together with my 5yr old as a helper in about 90 minutes. We followed the instructions carefully and had zero difficulties. Perhaps the instructions have been altered since some of the other reviews. Love the ease of use, tumbling, and door function. We've been using it for about a month with great result.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: The people that say it takes 3 plus hours to put together have no idea what they are talking about. I put this thing together in half an hour by myself very easy. The box came badly damaged but, all of the parts were included and nothing was broken or missing, so overall seems sturdy. The only thing I don’t like is the lid doesn’t secure on and slides off easily when you open it
customer_reviews.author: Zamaj

customer_reviews.title: So the box was not in the greatest of shape when it showed up but everything was ...
customer_reviews.text: So the box was not in the greatest of shape when it showed up but everything was there. Also, I'm almost 100% sure they collaborated with IKEA when it came to assembling this monster. After 2.5 tries and some helping from the wife, I was able to assemble and move around behind the house. it's completely full after a summer's worth of trimmings and weeds. To be honest, it was more a novelty hobby this year, to go full out we would need 4 of these for the 3/4 lot we have.
customer_reviews.author: King Lazareth

customer_reviews.title: Good and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to assemble if your good with tools and have more than they recommend, the thing that does not have my full 5 stars is the emptying the drum, you littery have to shovel it out instead of some method of just dumping into a wheel barrel and it's a little awkward to shovel out the compost.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Compost Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Lifetime 60058 compost tumbler I own. The first was purchased about 8 years ago and is still sturdy and functional. You’ll need two people to assemble - not because of weight, but to reach and steady the panels when fastening, etc. I’m confident this compost tumbler will be as well made and reliable as my first!
customer_reviews.author: skg815

customer_reviews.title: If You Can Handle The Assembly, It Can Be GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: WONDERFUL.....IF/WHEN you manage to get the daggone thing put together! What a nightmare! DEFINITELY NOT a 1 person project! Minimum 2 people needed for assembly. And....you better have PLENTY of your OWN tools! Drill, rubber mallet, socket wrenches, etc. Thanks to my awesome friend for hunkering down and helping me get it done! Now, I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Graham

customer_reviews.title: Needs more strength than I have to turn this tumbler
customer_reviews.text: The number one problem I have with this composter is that I cannot spin it. The spaces for handholds are too far apart to get good traction. I have to have my husband do the spinning. Other than that, if you are strong enough to turn the tumbler yourself, it is well made, and I have had no problem with the latches or the plastic pieces separating (a problem I had with a different brand).
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love it :)
customer_reviews.text: I love this compost Tumbler and it works really well. I have two of them, the first one came and the packaging was pretty beat up but the second one came great. the only reason i m giving it 4 stars is because it might be little hard for some people to put together. it does require a good power drill and for some people it might require two people to put it together. other than that they are great. Also it does require strength to spin it when its full.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Pohl

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product! Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: As per the many suggestions from other purchasers, I watched assembly videos on YouTube before I put mine together, so I didn't have any problems, although it is time-consuming. It's a great product! Very sturdy, and even when it's full, it's easy to tumble. I bought mine for a 10-unit townhouse complex and it's full after three months, so I'm going to purchase another one. Always a good idea to have one "cooking" while the other one is added to. The extra-large lid makes adding large amounts of yard waste easy, and I imagine it'll be useful when I'm ready to harvest my compost, too!
customer_reviews.author: Timi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Takes a lot of time to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews all said it was difficult to assemble. They were correct. It took 2 of us a few hours to assemble. Difficult that we even needed to drill our own holes in one part. The instructions were clear and made it possible to assemble. Overall love the product. Looking forward to see how it decomposes my wastes for nice soil!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Great Company Support
customer_reviews.text: My composter arrived in a mangled box and some of the parts were missing. I called the company and they were extremely helpful and I had the missing part in a couple of day, great support. The unit is really well built and I am very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Does the job as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It's big, it's black, it's spins and holds lots of grass clippings. I have a 2 year old 65 gallon Lifetime compost bin sitting right next to it. Wish I bought the 80 gallon unit 2 years ago. Seems like more than just 15 gallon difference. This thing is great. Relatively easy to put together by one person. I'm 6'1" and there are only a couple of screws that were a stretch to reach. But other than that, it's easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Cooper

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: This compost bin is the best. Multiple openings, a pin to hold it after you've spun it, so there is no wobbling, and I love how it is elevated off of the ground for easy turning and to keep it away from little animals. I love my compost bin and it makes composting fun when you can spin it yourself and feel it filling up. I am going to buy another soon so I can rotate my compost through.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Ani says
customer_reviews.text: I started composting years ago with a pile surrounded by chicken wire. I eventually graduated to two black plastic composting bins side by side so I could shift the contents back and forth for proper aeration. My daughter has one of these 80 Gal. Lifetime Compost Tumbler that I coveted. So she gave me my own for Mother's Day. Like her, it is perfect in every way. Even without compost starter it has cooked down remarkably fast and eliminates the back straining pitch fork turning. If I could, I would give this six stars. No whining over the assembly, keep thinking how much easier your life will be.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a pain for the total assembly (I recommend yoga if doing it alone) but it was doable
customer_reviews.text: One woman and a drill assembled it (with the help of my herd of curios dogs). Kind of a pain for the total assembly (I recommend yoga if doing it alone) but it was doable. Nice, heavy duty materials. I've had it for about a month and it's completely full with end-of-season yard debris and kitchen scraps. Already seeing the process work when I peek in and turn it weekly. Looking forward to spring!
customer_reviews.author: utahmomma

customer_reviews.title: Turning Point in Composting
customer_reviews.text: Have three now - what can I say. Durable and versatile for average gardener/flower enthusiast. I live in Northeast and the snow and extreme cold does not damage these, even when left out full for the winter. Remember these are 80 GAL capacity. When full, they can be somewhat difficult to rotate. I'm 66 years old, have small potbelly and don't work out each day and only have slight difficulty when full.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Crusan

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but hard to turn
customer_reviews.text: We are really enjoying this compost bin. I get so excited about saving scraps & being able to make compost in our tiny yard in the suburbs. It is, however, quite hard for me to turn this guy, when loaded just a little over half way. I'm 5'4" & not the strongest gal, & my arms don't extend far enough to make pulling it around easy. Now for my husband who's just a wee bit taller & a whole lot stronger, it's a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: AEH

customer_reviews.title: It is hands down the best composter your money can buy
customer_reviews.text: Heard about this from the Organic Gardend at Growing Your Greens on youtube. It is hands down the best composter your money can buy. Easy to use, solid built, and large enough to accomidate a good amount of compost needed. The only issue may be the assembly, as it is a bit complicated, to say the least. It took me a couple of hours. Still, well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Sarver

customer_reviews.title: We love our tumbler
customer_reviews.text: Great product, awesome size! Me and my husband fell really good by recycling paper and using our vegetables and fruits’ scraps to make compost for our garden. :) It is very hard to assemble. The piece that lock and unlock it is really small for such a big tumbler. But overall it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Composting
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these now and I really like them. I love the overall capacity and the build quality seems very good. Assembly takes awhile but I knew that going into it. I would (and have) recommended this composter to anyone wanting to get started with composting.
customer_reviews.author: bigc97

customer_reviews.title: Just assembled last night so this is a pretty early review
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled last night so this is a pretty early review. Assembly was not terribly difficult if you’ve assembled things from (kinda crappy) instructions before. But two people are required at times, but inestly I just had to borrow my wife for 10 minutes of the 90min ish construction. Tumbler seems well constructed and sturdy. As soon as I finished building it, I put about 100lbs if material in it and it held just fine. Tumbling a heavy load like that isn’t what I’d call “easy”, but not particularly difficult either.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great composter
customer_reviews.text: I truly love my composter! The only issue I had was that a few screws were hard to screws all the way in during assembly, and two screwheads got stripped as a result. Other than that, it works wonderfully! Easy to use and holds plenty of composting material.
customer_reviews.author: Moiese

customer_reviews.title: IKEA eat
customer_reviews.text: I (Dan’s wife) was not expecting this to come in a million pieces. Instructions were good though. The only problem I had was with the screw covers, I had to cut the wings off to get them to fit into the spaces. Holds a lot and turns well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wells

customer_reviews.title: Good value.. for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall the unit is pretty nice for the money. However, the packaging was ridiculously worn and torn and almost let the hardware package fall out. I still can’t justify the price and h omg to drill my own pilot holes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P Le Blanc

customer_reviews.title: Not to difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the reviews that say it was an issue assembling this. It wasn't that difficult. Use your own drill bit, and a impact driver, and you will be fine. An extra hand is NEEDED.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kopas

customer_reviews.title: Nice, big tumbler!
customer_reviews.text: Takes an hour or so to put it together but man... I have put a truckload of organic material in this thing and it just keeps on eating it! I just love compost its the best fertilizer there is!
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Next to impossible to assemble using the screws that were provided. You need to go to the hardware store and purchase self tapping screws. Probably should pick up an extra drill bit while your there. It's disturbing that for the kind of money this thing costs the can't send the proper screws, make me wonder what else is a cheap as they can buy. I would send it back but I waited too long to try to put it together. When I get self tapping screws I'll up date this report
customer_reviews.author: crab catcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Vast improvement to our compost pile that attracted squirrels, raccoons, and other unwanted varmints. I made 2 "improvements", a handle for opening the lid easily to put stuff in, and since I already had an 18" thermometer, I used a wine cork to center it in the air pipe without blocking the airflow. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Good composter but a pain to construct.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good composter but was difficult to construct. It seems durable and allows turning for faster compost. But putting it together was a major chore even for a very handy person with all the tools. The mfr could do a better job of designing the kit such as pre-drilling holes. I like the size and function. If you are not handy I would choose another. Also the hinged access door swings too far back causing stress on the hinges. I put mine against a tree to stop it from swinging too far back.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Dave

customer_reviews.title: The product is rock solid and easy to put together if you are mechanically inclined
customer_reviews.text: We are excited to compost with this being a great tool. Have been doing composting for quite a while but used ice chest which was messy and limited. The Compost Tumbler is much larger and enclosed and has a handle to spin the compost every few days. Bravo! I only wish I could get another one.
customer_reviews.author: James Magsamen

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fast breakdown of organic matter. (Assembly required)
customer_reviews.text: This compost tumbler works great. It does require extensive assembly but well worth the labor. I bought this unit in mid summer and began filling it with kitchen scraps, dead leaves and some soil from my graded to get the process moving. I have been amazed at how fast organic material breaks down in this composer. I am excited to uses this fresh compost to get my spring garden into full production. I have read that some people feel the barrel gets to heavy and is hard to turn, but for me I view it as some needed exercise outside in the fresh air! Highly recommend this tumbler if you are looking for a low maintenance solution for composting!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Love it but read assembly instructions carefully!
customer_reviews.text: Love this composter. It does take 2 people to put together and pay attention to the picture directions. Do not jump ahead and be mindful of the direction when installing the pin. The large size makes it more challenging to turn and some kind of handle to help in turning would have been ideal.
customer_reviews.author: kylie

customer_reviews.title: what a piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the most tedious things i"ve ordered to put together. The included drill bit broke broke almost immediately. The design is terrible. Save yourself the money, put a couple pallets together and just flip your compost every now and then with a rake. I wish my wife had not bought this item.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: We like that it can lock at various positions around the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a large compost bin but will hold a lot of compost. It does however get heavy and a little hard to spin, but it mixes well and contains any smells. We like that it can lock at various positions around the bin, but I have found that if the opening is not at the top when locked and they are at any angle or the opening it at the bottom, then I cannot pull out the pin easily to spin and open it. I have to have someone help me because it is quiet heavy. Overall a great bin for composting
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s Ok....
customer_reviews.text: The box came in severely damaged! The assembly was nowhere near as easy as it should’ve been and the directions need to be explained better. The packaging for the nuts and bolts were absolutely ridiculous to open and then once you opened it they fell everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Missing essential parts
customer_reviews.text: Very small crucial and essential parts weren't available on arrival and now I have to pay out of pocket in finding these items that should of came with the box. On top of all that, theres no support in gaining these missing parts and the box came in a very broken tape covered mess. Highly unacceptable for what I paid for. I dont know when I'll finish with assembly, but it wont be a few days from now, or maybe even weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Best invention!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is rad!!! We will be purchasing another one. This year we have really got to use it more and see what it does. We have used the compost that breaks down in our garden, flowerbeds etc. It is amazing how well compost turns to dirt in this. Wonderful wonderful WONDERFUL product! Couldn't be happier. I want another one! Thank You very much!
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer Perry

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Missing the middle bar so now I have to wait to finish my bin. Two thumbs up.... NOT
customer_reviews.author: Robert F

customer_reviews.title: Rotates easily, no tea collection
customer_reviews.text: Assemled in a half-hour. It's very easy to rotate the drum, which is an important feature when it starts filling. Took away a star because there is no way to collect the composting tea (the liquid that drains from the bottom of a compost pile). Composting tea is a very valuable source of nutrients for your plants. There are other bins that have a way of collecting the tea, but they aren't so easy to rotate.
customer_reviews.author: Fellrunner

customer_reviews.title: Ok bin but the smaller one's better.
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived broken with some parts missing. Lifetime sent me the missing parts within a week. Assembly was easy. Overall, this bin feels a bit more flimsy than my smaller bin from Lifetime, but still suitable to the task.
customer_reviews.author: snipe

customer_reviews.title: One-person assembly in 45 minutes, piece of cake!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I did it myself in 45 minutes with a cordless drill driver, a handheld screwdriver, a couple wrenches, and the included drill. I have been using it for a month or so now and my first batch of compost is coming along wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: silversurfer

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Used to compost kitchen scraps, leaves, chicken coop straw and droppings. It is very heavy when full and not that easy to turn if you don't have good upper body strength. Love that it is rodent proof.
customer_reviews.author: Island gal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We looked around for a while for a compost bin, found this one, and went for it. Other have mentioned that assembly is a process (hence the 4 stars and not 5), and they're right. PLEASE do yourself a favor and check out the customer images from "Tee Ball". What he came up with is the right way to do this. - THANK YOU FRANK! - Once together, the bin is a good size, it's well balanced, spins easily, closes tight, seals well, the lid opens fully for access (and comes off as well). We're very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MIDIWall

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Grow Composter Review
customer_reviews.text: The online instructions were very easy to use. The green clips that hold the 6 side panals together were a little hard to attach. After 2 or 3 of the panels are fastened together, it is easier to attach the rest if you have someone else to hold the panels together while you attach the green clips. Once assembled, the composter seems sturdy. When attaching the 2 ends to the panels. Make sure the ends have seated correctly or the ends may come loose.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Dillinger

customer_reviews.title: Bin is nice, instructions are terrible
customer_reviews.text: Be warned that this is not a snap together item. You need to drill holes in several of the panels in order to screw everything together. Also the instructions are mostly pictures, which I think they thought would make things easier but end up being confusing. Once you (and preferably someone to help) get it put together, it's a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pena

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied with the tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. Construction was fairly quick as long as you have a helper, took about 30 minutes. Packaging was a little worrisome as the box came partly damaged and the tapes holding it together were falling apart. the contents inside was lose and moving around when i moved the box. Despite that, all the pieces were there and appears to have no physical damage with the contents moving around. overall, very satisfied with the tumbler.
customer_reviews.author: Remy Um

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy, a little hard to turn
customer_reviews.text: I've now had this tumbler for several months and It's made my life so much easier. I just keep a small bucket outside my house for organic waste, and when it fills up I transfer it to the large tumbler. Pros: -it was easy to assemble, even by myself as a weakling -very sturdy and well made -garbage turns into compost! -enough drainage that liquid escapes and doesn't putrify Cons: -can be difficult to spin when it isn't empty -when it does spin, sometimes "juice" leaks out the top and gets on the latches Overall, I'm pretty happy - good product for the price
customer_reviews.author: displaced Washingtonian

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged and missing assembly package.
customer_reviews.text: Box came damaged and reboxed. It was open and BIT package which contains five assorted items were missing! We had to put our Community Garden project on hold. This is second product ordered. First one came unbroken and is very sturdy once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rockwood

customer_reviews.title: Great composter!!
customer_reviews.text: It works very well! It is very sturdy and makes beautiful compost! It spins well. My only complaint is that sometimes the lid shifts and you have to get it back in place but its no biggie. I have had mine for at least a year. I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The material this is made with is good. The wing nuts are very difficult to put ...
customer_reviews.text: The material this is made with is good. The wing nuts are very difficult to put on by yourself, and it leaks. So don't keep this anywhere you don't want stains. I would have thought it would be more solid given your putting food stuff in there to rot. But, It's better than a hole in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: The Home Show Hostess

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and great costumer service
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could start composting faster. I have composted for a while but I am to lazy to turn a pile so it always ended up in a heap and was never used since getting this my compost has broke down very quickly. It is kinda hard to put together and I would definitely have someone help you put it together but it works great and it seems like it will last a long time. I did break the locking pin on it about 3 weeks in but I contacted lifetime and a day later they sent me a new one express for free. Now I just need a second one so I constantly have compost available.
customer_reviews.author: Big and Tasty

customer_reviews.title: Great While It Lasted
customer_reviews.text: This was great while it lasted, but I've had it for 2 and a half years and its collapsing under its own weight. The bolts have ripped out of the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Missing part!
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived and had been previously returned. After partial assembly, we realized that it is missing a part and now we are at a standstill until a part is sent to us. Our expectation is that we will just receive a replacement for the missing part, as this is now taking uo our entire garage and cannot be repackaged for pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So pleased I now have 2
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I have 2 so one can be cooking while I load the other. They really do a good job and hold up very well. I like doing compost this way.
customer_reviews.author: MEM

product_meta.title: Lifetime 60058 Compost Tumbler, Black, 80-Gallon
product_meta.description: Featuring a 80-gallon (10.72 cubic feet) capacity, the Lifetime compost tumbler is the perfect addition to your backyard. The ingenious tumbler design easily turns on its axis for balance rotation, and the internal aeration bar mixes compost and provides air flow. Constructed of high-density polyethylene (HDPE), the compost tumbler is durable, UV-protected, and has dark, double-wall panels to absorb and retain heat. For added convenience, it has an extra large removable lid and a spring-loaded pin that locks rotation during filling. The composter is black with a galvanized steel base, and comes in 1 box, with a how to compost DVD included. Easy assembly with all hardware included.
feature_bullets: High Density Polyethylene (HDPE) Plastic, Powder-Coated steel
Tumbler capacity: 80 gallon, 10.72 cubic feet. Tumbler Design : Single Tumbler
Double walled panels to absorb and retain the heat that decomposes the material
Internal bar mixes the compost and allows the flow of oxygen
Tumbler easy turns on its axis for balanced rotation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars900 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
